metadata.generatedFrom: 6,797 question bank analysis + IPM curriculum mapping across Grades 2-9

cards.front: What is the place value of a digit?
cards.back: The value of a digit based on its position in the number. E.g., 5 in 5,432 = 5,000

cards.front: What is the face value of a digit?
cards.back: The digit itself, regardless of position. Face value of 5 is always 5.
The difference! E.g., 5 in 4,562: PV=500, FV=5, Difference=495
The number just BEFORE it. Subtract 1. Predecessor of 1,00,000 = 99,999
The number just AFTER it. Add 1. Successor of 99,999 = 1,00,000

cards.front: To form LARGEST number from digits?
cards.back: Arrange digits in DESCENDING order. But first digit can't be 0!

cards.front: To form SMALLEST number from digits?
cards.back: Arrange in ASCENDING order. Put smallest non-zero digit first, then 0, then rest ascending.
A number is even if its last digit is 0, 2, 4, 6, or 8
A number is odd if its last digit is 1, 3, 5, 7, or 9
I before V or X → subtract (IV=4, IX=9). X before L or C → subtract (XL=40, XC=90). C before D or M → subtract (CD=400, CM=900)

cards.front: Which symbols can NEVER be subtracted?
cards.back: V, L, D can NEVER be used for subtraction. VX is INVALID!
I, X, C, M can repeat up to 3 times. V, L, D can NEVER repeat.

cards.front: How many times is V used in I to XX?
cards.back: Count: V, IV, VI, VII, VIII, XIV, XV, XVI, XVII, XVIII. V appears in all of these!
A number with exactly 2 factors: 1 and itself. E.g., 2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13...
NO! 1 is neither prime nor composite. It has only 1 factor.
2 is the ONLY even prime number.
Product of the two numbers! HCF × LCM = a × b
Sum of all digits is divisible by 3
Last TWO digits form a number divisible by 4
Sum of all digits divisible by 9
(Sum of digits at odd places) − (Sum of digits at even places) is 0 or divisible by 11
Two numbers with HCF = 1. E.g., 9 and 16 are co-prime.
Fractions with the SAME denominator. E.g., 2/5, 3/5, 4/5
Multiply whole × denominator + numerator, keep denominator. 3²/₅ = (3×5+2)/5 = 17/5
Divide numerator by denominator. Quotient = whole, Remainder = new numerator. 23/4 = 5³/₄
Find LCM of denominators, convert to like fractions, then add. 1/3 + 1/4 = 4/12 + 3/12 = 7/12
Same value, different numbers. Multiply or divide both top and bottom by same number. 3/4 = 6/8 = 9/12
Compare digit by digit from left. 0.45 > 0.405 (compare tenths: both 4, compare hundredths: 5 > 0)
Decimals with same number of decimal places. Make like by adding zeros: 5.2 and 0.303 → 5.200 and 0.303
After the point: tenths (1/10), hundredths (1/100), thousandths (1/1000)
Brackets → Of → Division → Multiplication → Addition → Subtraction
cards.formula: B \rightarrow O \rightarrow D \rightarrow M \rightarrow A \rightarrow S

cards.front: D and M have equal priority
cards.back: Division and Multiplication: work LEFT to RIGHT, whichever comes first

cards.front: A and S have equal priority
cards.back: Addition and Subtraction: work LEFT to RIGHT, whichever comes first
( ) first, then { }, then [ ]. Innermost brackets first!
Step 1: Subtract b from both sides → ax = c−b. Step 2: Divide by a → x = (c−b)/a
Move all x terms to one side, all numbers to other. 12x−40=2x → 10x=40 → x=4
Replace the letter with its value and calculate. If a=3, find 2a+5 → 2(3)+5 = 11
Perimeter = sum of all sides. Rectangle: 2(L+B). For algebraic sides, ADD the expressions first, then multiply by 2.
Combine LIKE TERMS only. 3a + 2b + 5a = 8a + 2b (can't combine a and b!)
Age gap NEVER changes! If A is 5 years older than B today, A will ALWAYS be 5 years older.
In t years, sum of ages increases by (number of people × t). Two people: sum increases by 2t.
Two angles that add up to 90°. If one is 35°, the other is 55°.
Two angles that add up to 180°.

cards.front: Sum of complement + supplement of an angle
cards.back: For angle x: complement = (90−x), supplement = (180−x). Sum = 270 − 2x
Hour hand is between X and X+1. Calculate: |30×X + 15 − 180| for the angle.

cards.front: Sum of angles in a triangle

cards.back: Sum of any two sides MUST be greater than the third side.
All 3 sides equal. All 3 angles = 60°. 3 axes of symmetry.
2 sides equal. 2 base angles equal. 1 axis of symmetry.

cards.front: Isosceles: if one angle is X°
cards.back: Two cases! Case 1: X is the vertex angle → base angles = (180−X)/2. Case 2: X is a base angle → vertex = 180−2X
Sum of all three sides: a + b + c

cards.front: Can a triangle have two right angles?
cards.back: NO! 90+90=180, leaving 0° for the third angle. Impossible.
All angles 90°. Opposite sides equal. 2 axes of symmetry. Diagonals equal.
All sides equal. All angles 90°. 4 axes of symmetry. Diagonals equal & bisect at 90°.
When side = 4! P = 4×4 = 16. A = 4² = 16. Only square where P equals A numerically.
Opposite sides parallel AND equal. Opposite angles equal.
All sides equal (equilateral parallelogram). Diagonals bisect at 90°. 2 axes of symmetry.
Exactly ONE pair of parallel sides.
TRUE! A square has all the properties of a rectangle PLUS equal sides.

cards.front: Rectangle cut into squares — perimeter trick
cards.back: Sum of perimeters of pieces > original perimeter. The cuts ADD new edges!
If P is equal: 4×s_sq = 3×s_tri → s_sq = 3s_tri/4. Square side is SMALLER.
The DIAMETER is the longest chord.
INFINITE! Every diameter is an axis of symmetry.
n points → n(n−1)/2 chords. 5 points = 10 chords. 6 points = 15 chords.
Jan=31, Feb=28/29, Mar=31, Apr=30, May=31, Jun=30, Jul=31, Aug=31, Sep=30, Oct=31, Nov=30, Dec=31
Divisible by 4 = leap year. BUT century years (1900, 2100) must be divisible by 400. So 2000=leap, 1900=NOT leap.
Normal year = 365 days = 52 weeks + 1 odd day. Leap year = 366 = 52 weeks + 2 odd days.
Same date next normal year = 1 day later. If Jan 1 is Monday, next Jan 1 is Tuesday.
After a leap year, same date advances by 2 days (Feb 29 adds an extra day).

cards.front: 31-day month: how many days appear 5 times?
cards.back: 3 days! (31 = 4×7 + 3, so 3 days get a 5th occurrence)

cards.front: 30-day month: how many days appear 5 times?

cards.back: Gaining: actual elapsed time × gain rate. If gains 2 min/hour and 12 hours pass: shows 12h + 24min extra.
Simply subtract: June 3 to June 28 = 25 days
Remaining days in first month + full months between + days in last month
Each term increases by a CONSTANT difference. 3, 7, 11, 15... (difference = 4)

cards.front: Number of terms in a sequence
Sum of first n natural numbers

cards.back: All rows, columns, AND diagonals add to the SAME number (magic constant).
Magic constant ÷ 3 = center number. If constant = 54, center = 18.

cards.front: 3×3 magic square: magic constant from numbers
cards.back: Sum of all 9 numbers ÷ 3 = magic constant.
Numbers that come after the first and before the last. Between 5 and 9: 6, 7, 8
Even! 0 can be divided by 2 with no remainder.
Numbers arranged from smallest to largest. 23, 45, 67, 89
Numbers arranged from largest to smallest. 89, 67, 45, 23
Numbers that come one after another with no gap. 5, 6, 7, 8
The result of adding numbers. Sum of 3 and 5 = 8
The result of subtracting. Difference of 10 and 6 = 4
The number stays the same. 25 + 0 = 25. Zero is the additive identity.
Yes! 3 + 5 = 5 + 3. Order doesn't matter in addition.
The same number! 7 × 1 = 7. One is the multiplicative identity.
Just add a 0 at the end! 7 × 10 = 70
Sharing into equal groups. 12 ÷ 3 = 4 means 12 shared into 3 groups of 4
No! Division by zero is undefined. It's impossible.
One half — cut something into 2 equal parts, take 1 part
One third — cut into 3 equal parts, take 1 part
One quarter — cut into 4 equal parts, take 1 part
Three quarters — cut into 4 parts, take 3. That's most of it!
1/2 is bigger! Smaller bottom number = bigger piece

cards.front: What fraction is shaded if 3 out of 8 parts?
What does the top number (numerator) tell us?
cards.back: How many parts we have or are talking about

cards.front: What does the bottom number (denominator) tell us?
cards.back: How many equal parts the whole is divided into

cards.front: How many days in a week?
How many months in a year?
How many days in a year?
What does the short hand on a clock show?
What does the long hand on a clock show?
If you buy something for Rs.35 and pay Rs.50, change = ?
Which is heavier: 1 kg or 500 gm?
Which is longer: 1 m or 50 cm?
How many sides does a triangle have?
How many sides does a rectangle have?
How many sides does a square have?
How many sides does a circle have?
cards.back: 0 sides! A circle has a curved edge, not straight sides

cards.front: What is a line of symmetry?
cards.back: A line that divides a shape into two mirror-image halves

cards.front: How many lines of symmetry does a square have?
What shape has all sides equal and all angles 90°?

cards.back: Total distance around a shape — add up all the sides
8 (add the two before: 3+5=8). This is the Fibonacci pattern!
The shape flipped as if reflected in a mirror. Left becomes right.
A number that reads the same forwards and backwards. Like 121, 343, 1001
A graph using pictures to show data. Each picture = a number of items
A graph using bars of different heights to compare quantities

cards.front: What does 'most' mean in a graph?
cards.back: The tallest bar or the most pictures — the largest quantity

cards.front: What does 'least' mean in a graph?
cards.back: The shortest bar or fewest pictures — the smallest quantity
7 (face value is always the digit itself)
A number that divides another exactly. Factors of 12: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12
The result of multiplying. Multiples of 3: 3, 6, 9, 12, 15...
For 2-digit numbers: split digits and add in middle. 36 × 11 = 3_(3+6)_6 = 396
Sum of digits divisible by 3. E.g., 123: 1+2+3=6 ✓
Sum of digits divisible by 9. E.g., 729: 7+2+9=18 ✓
Fractions with the same denominator. 2/7 and 5/7
Cross multiply! a/b vs c/d: compare a×d with b×c
No sides equal, no angles equal

cards.front: Sum of angles in a triangle?

cards.back: Exactly 90°. Like the corner of a book.
Less than 90°. Smaller than a right angle.
Between 90° and 180°. Wider than a right angle.
30 days: Sep, Apr, Jun, Nov. All rest 31, except Feb (28/29)
Divisible by 4 (except centuries: must be divisible by 400). Feb has 29 days
No! Century years must be divisible by 400. 1900 ÷ 400 ≠ whole number

cards.front: How many days from 1 Jan to 1 Mar (non-leap)?

cards.back: Smaller BEFORE larger = subtract. IV=4, IX=9, XL=40, XC=90, CD=400, CM=900
Smaller AFTER larger = add. VI=6, XI=11, LX=60
I, X, C, M can repeat max 3 times. III=3, XXX=30. IIII is WRONG!
Graph using rectangular bars to show data. Taller bar = bigger value
Graph using pictures/symbols. Each symbol represents a fixed number

cards.front: What does the scale in a pictograph mean?
cards.back: How many items each symbol represents. If 🍎 = 5 apples, then 🍎🍎🍎 = 15
The original money borrowed or invested

cards.front: SI on Rs.1000 at 5% for 2 years?
SI on Rs.500 at 10% for 3 years?

cards.back: The price at which something is bought
The price at which something is sold
When SP > CP. Profit = SP - CP
When CP > SP. Loss = CP - SP

Finding CP from SP and profit%?

cards.back: Highest Common Factor — the biggest number that divides both exactly. HCF of 12, 18 = 6
Least Common Multiple — the smallest number that both divide into. LCM of 4, 6 = 12
Product of the two numbers! LCM(a,b) × HCF(a,b) = a × b
Always 1! Co-prime means no common factor except 1. E.g., 8 and 15
When do bells ring together? Find LCM of all intervals!
Greatest equal length = find HCF of the ribbon lengths!
A letter (like x, y, a) that represents an unknown number
A combination of numbers, variables, and operations. E.g., 3x + 2y - 5
A statement that two expressions are equal. E.g., 3x + 5 = 20
The number multiplied by a variable. In 5x, the coefficient is 5
A number without a variable. In 3x + 7, the constant is 7
Two angles that add up to 90°
Two angles that add up to 180°

cards.front: Sum of angles in a quadrilateral?

cards.back: Approximately 22/7 or 3.14159... The ratio of circumference to diameter
+3 (different signs → subtract, keep sign of bigger)

cards.front: Order of integers on number line?

cards.back: Comparison of two quantities. Ratio of 6 to 4 = 6:4 = 3:2

cards.front: What is simplest form of a ratio?
cards.back: Divide both parts by HCF. 12:8 → divide by 4 → 3:2
Two equal ratios. a:b = c:d means a/b = c/d
If a/b = c/d then a×d = b×c
As one increases, the other increases. More workers = less time is NOT direct (that's inverse).
As one increases, the other decreases. More workers → less time to finish
½ × d₁ × d₂ (half product of diagonals)

cards.front: Parallel lines cut by transversal: alternate angles?
cards.back: Equal! Alternate interior angles are equal when lines are parallel.
Equal! In same position relative to transversal.
Ratio of (Capital × Time) for each partner

cards.front: A invests Rs.45000 for 12 months, B invests Rs.30000 for 9 months. Ratio?

cards.back: Sum of all values ÷ Number of values

cards.front: New average when a person joins?
cards.back: New sum = old sum + new person's value. Then divide by new count.
Interest calculated on principal + accumulated interest. Interest on interest!

cards.front: CI on Rs.1000 at 10% for 2 years?

cards.back: Half the annual rate, double the time. R/2 for 2T periods
Same shape AND same size. Can be placed on top of each other exactly.
Same shape but possibly different size. Same angles, proportional sides.
If all 3 sides of one triangle equal all 3 sides of another → congruent
If 2 sides and the INCLUDED angle are equal → congruent
If 2 angles and the INCLUDED side are equal → congruent
For right triangles: if Hypotenuse and one Side are equal → congruent
Corresponding Parts of Congruent Triangles (are equal)
In right triangle: a²+b²=c² (hypotenuse² = sum of other sides²)
Expression with variables using +,−,× and whole number exponents. E.g., 3x²+2x−5
Highest power of variable. Degree of 4x³+2x−1 is 3
Remainder when P(x) is divided by (x−a) = P(a)
If P(a)=0, then (x−a) is a factor of P(x)
Find two numbers: product=6, sum=5 → 2,3. So (x+2)(x+3)
b²−4ac. If >0: 2 real roots. If =0: 1 root. If <0: no real roots
A collection of well-defined distinct objects. {1, 2, 3, 4, 5}
Union — all elements in A or B or both
Intersection — elements in BOTH A and B

cards.formula: n(A \cup B) = n(A) + n(B) - n(A \cap B)

cards.back: All elements NOT in A (but in the universal set)
A set with no elements. Written as {} or ∅
A ⊂ B means every element of A is also in B
Equation where highest power of variable is 1. E.g., 3x+5=20
Two equations with two unknowns. Solve both together to find x and y
Make coefficients of one variable equal, then add/subtract equations
Express one variable in terms of other from one equation, substitute in second
Opposite / Adjacent = sin θ / cos θ
Sin=Opp/Hyp, Cos=Adj/Hyp, Tan=Opp/Adj. 'Some Old Houses Can Always Hide Their Old Age'

cards.front: Trick: sin and cos are complements!
cards.back: sin θ = cos(90°−θ). So sin 30° = cos 60° = 1/2
Elevation: looking UP from horizontal. Depression: looking DOWN from horizontal.
Power to which a must be raised to get b. log₂(8) = 3 because 2³=8
An ordered pair (x, y) giving a point's position on the plane
Middle value when data is sorted

NO! AAA proves SIMILARITY, not congruence. Triangles could be different sizes.

cards.front: If triangles are similar, ratio of areas?
cards.back: Square of ratio of sides. If sides ratio 2:3, area ratio 4:9

cards.back: Think: 8+2=10, then +5=15. Break numbers to make 10!
The answer when you add numbers. Sum of 6 and 9 is 15.
The answer when you subtract. Difference of 15 and 9 is 6.

cards.front: Adding zero to any number gives?
cards.back: The same number! 45 + 0 = 45. Zero is the additive identity.
No! 3+5 = 5+3 = 8. This is called the commutative property.
When digits add up to 10 or more, carry 1 to the next column. 27+15: 7+5=12, write 2 carry 1.
When the top digit is smaller, borrow 10 from the next column. 42−18: borrow from 4, make 12−8=4.
A number that reads the same forwards and backwards. E.g., 121, 454, 1001
The number itself! 7 × 1 = 7. One is the multiplicative identity.

Never! Division by zero is undefined/impossible.

What is the difference between a square and a rectangle?
cards.back: A square has ALL sides equal. A rectangle has opposite sides equal. Every square IS a rectangle!

cards.front: How to find total from a pictograph?
cards.back: Count all symbols and multiply by what each symbol represents.
Something that repeats in a predictable way. E.g., red, blue, red, blue → next is red!
In a mirror, left becomes right and right becomes left. But top and bottom stay the same!

cards.back: 180°. Always! This is the angle sum property.

cards.back: Jan has 31 days, Feb has 28. Total = 59 days. 59÷7 = 8 weeks + 3 days. Mon+3 = Thursday.

cards.front: What is the range of data?
cards.back: Largest value − Smallest value. Data: 3,7,2,9,5 → Range = 9−2 = 7

cards.front: Reading a bar graph: which is tallest?
cards.back: The tallest bar represents the highest value. Compare bar heights carefully!

cards.front: If (x−1) is a factor of P(x), then P(1)=?
How to find a polynomial from its zeros?
cards.back: If zeros are α and β: P(x) = x² − (α+β)x + αβ
Since P(−1)=−1+2+1−2=0, (x+1) is a factor. Result: x²+x−2 = (x+2)(x−1)
The price at which an item is bought.
The price at which an item is sold.
When SP > CP. Profit = SP − CP
When CP > SP. Loss = CP − SP
P=Principal, R=Rate%, T=Time(years). Always divide by 100!

cards.front: SI on Rs.2000 at 8% for 3 years?

cards.back: A combination of numbers, variables, and operations. E.g., 3x+2y−5
Like: same variable and power (3x², 5x²). Unlike: different (3x², 5x)

cards.front: Train crosses a pole in 10 sec at 72 km/hr. Length of train?

cards.back: Subtract speeds. If A=60 km/hr, B=40 km/hr, relative speed = 20 km/hr
Add speeds. If A=60 km/hr, B=40 km/hr, relative speed = 100 km/hr

cards.back: A line segment joining two points on a circle. Diameter is the longest chord!

cards.back: Any number that can be written as p/q where q≠0. Includes fractions, integers, terminating/repeating decimals.
No! √2 is irrational — it cannot be expressed as p/q. Its decimal never terminates or repeats.
Find one: (1/3+1/2)/2 = 5/12. There are infinite rationals between any two rationals!
a×d = b×c. Use this to solve proportion problems.
Let current age = x. 'Was' means subtract years. 'Will be' means add years.
Chance of an event = Favorable outcomes ÷ Total outcomes. Always between 0 and 1.

cards.back: If c²=a²+b² for a triangle, then it IS a right triangle.
The printed price on an item. The price BEFORE any discount.
A single mathematical expression: 3x², −5y, 7 are all terms.
2+3=5. Add powers of all variables in a term.
Find numbers multiplying to 12, adding to 7: 3 and 4. Answer: (x+3)(x+4)

cards.back: Same as CI! P_new = P(1 + R/100)^T
Value = Original × (1 − R/100)^T. SUBTRACT the rate!
Always 90°. Any angle inscribed in a semicircle is a right angle!
Tangent is always perpendicular to the radius at the point of contact (90°).
Two tangents from an external point are EQUAL in length.

cards.front: Length of tangent from point P, distance d from centre, radius r?

cards.back: Equal and parallel. Opposite angles also equal.
All sides equal. Diagonals bisect each other at 90°.
Exactly one pair of opposite sides is parallel.
Equal in length and bisect each other (but NOT at 90°).
Equal, bisect each other at 90°. A square is a rhombus AND a rectangle!
From eq2: x=5−y. Sub into eq1: 2(5−y)+3y=12 → y=2, x=3
Line joining midpoints of two sides of a triangle is parallel to the third side and half its length.
3 points are collinear if area of triangle formed = 0
